required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Radiotherapy of Pelvic Lymph Nodes in High Risk Prostate Cancer - A Retrospective Analysis
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospektive Analyse Der Radiotherapie Des Pelvinen Lymphabflusses Beim Lokalisierten Prostatakarzinom Vom Hochrisikotyp Anhand Der Klinikdatenbank 2010-2016

brief_summary.textblock: Men with high risk prostate cancer who underwent radiotherapy of the prostate/seminal vesicles or underwent postoperative radiotherapy including pelvic lymph nodes between 2010 and 2016 are analyzed retrospectively. The aims are to estimate progression-free survival as well as toxicity according to CTCAE v4.03.

detailed_description.textblock:
Collection of data and retrospective analysis of patients with high risk prostate cancer treated with radiotherapy to pelvic lymph nodes.
What influence has irradiation of pelvic lymph nodes on patients with high risk prostate cancer in terms of progression free survival and toxicity. How does this influence side effects with respect to gastrointestinal (proctitis, abdominal pain, diarrhea) and genitourinary (cystitis, urinary disorders) toxicities (CTCAE v4.03)

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 years
primary_outcome.description: PSA progession-free survival will be measured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: GI, GU Toxicities as well as Erectile Dysfunction will be measured

arm_group.description: Radiation to prostate/seminal vesicles including pelvic lymph nodes Postoperative radiation to prostate bed including pelvic lymph nodes

intervention.description: Radiation to prostate/seminal vesicles including pelvic lymph nodes Postoperative radiation to prostate bed including pelvic lymph nodes

study_pop.textblock: Retrospective analysis of men irradiated for high risk prostate cancer including pelvic lymph nodes (L5/S1)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men with high risk prostate cancer treated with radiotherapy to prostate/seminal vesicles or postoperative radiotherapy and pelvic lymph nodes at the Kantonssptial Graubuenden, Department of Radiation Oncology between 2010 and 2016
Exclusion Criteria:
- Men with prostate cancer other than high risk disease and no radiotherapy to pelvic lymph nodes
